remark.p: Foreign Service Officer. Assistant Secretary of State for Western Hemisphere Affairs; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic, Energy, and Business Affairs; Representative of the U.S.A. to the European Union, with the rank and status of Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary; Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary (Spain); Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary (Canada).

Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for International Monetary Affairs, Bureau of Economic Affairs, until August 1969; Deputy Chief of Mission in Belgrade, August 1969-December 1970; Deputy Chief of Mission in Phnom Penh from January 1971
Deputy Chief of Mission at the Embassy in Cambodia
Deputy Chief of Mission, U.S. Embassy in Phnom Penh until February 1974
Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs until December 22, 1975; Ambassador to Canada from February 17, 1976

Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for International Monetary Affairs, Bureau of Economic Affairs, until August 1969; Deputy Chief of Mission in Belgrade, August 1969–December 1971; Deputy Chief of Mission in Phnom Penh from January 1972
Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from June 1974 until December 1975
Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for International Monetary Affairs, Bureau of Economic Affairs, until August 1969; Deputy Chief of Mission in Belgrade, August 1969–December 1971
Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from July 1974 until December 1975; Ambassador to Canada from December 1975
Assistant Secretary for Economic and Business Affairs from July 24, 1974 until December 22, 1975; U.S. Ambassador to Canada from February 17, 1976

Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs until December 22, 1975; Ambassador to Canada from December 22, 1975 until September 14, 1979; Representative to the European Communities from November 6, 1979
Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs, July 24, 1974–December 22, 1975; Ambassador to Canada from February 17, 1976

Chargé d’Affaires ad interim, U.S. Embassy in Phnom Penh until 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from July 24, 1974, until December 22, 1975; U.S. Ambassador to Canada from February 17, 1976

Chargé d’Affaires ad interim to the Khmer Republic (Cambodia) until 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from July 24, 1974, until December 22, 1975; U.S. Ambassador to Canada from February 17, 1976

Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for International Monetary Affairs,Bureau of Economic Affairs, until August 1969; Deputy Chief of Mission in Belgrade, August 1969–December 1971; Deputy Chief of Mission in Phnom Penh from January 1972

Deputy Chief of Mission and Chargé d’Affaires in Phenom Penh from September 5, 1973 until March 14, 1974; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs, Department of State from June 30, 1974 until December 22, 1975; thereafter U.S. Ambassador to Canada
Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from July 24, 1974, until December 22, 1975; U.S. Ambassador to Canada from February 17, 1976
Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from July 1974 until December 1975; Ambassador to Canada from December 1975 until September 1979
U.S. Ambassador to Canada until September 1979; Representative to the European Communities from November 1979
Assistant Secretary of State for Inter-American Affairs from June 23, 1981, until June 27, 1983
